author: WorfKlingon
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce
Launch update_suite.sh with mintty
Launch media-autobuild_suite.bat with PowerShel 7.03
```powershell

```

## Expected behavior
building all libraries
```none

```

## Actual behavior
unable to compile libmediainfo
```none

```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


same issue with;
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.19041.610
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.19041.610
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
[logs.zip](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/5486128/logs.zip)


It's my first test with your tool and my opinion it's a powerfull tool. I hope that i provide properly my issue in right location


```

comments.author: WorfKlingon
comments.body:
Sorry to all
I put my bug in wrong place.
You can remove it.
Sorry again

title: My bug report
